pull.title: Make IsSegWitOutput return true for taproot outputs
pull.body: This fixes a bug: currently `utxoupdatepsbt` will not fill in UTXO data for PSBTs spending taproot outputs.

events.body: ACK, but I like @MarcoFalke's suggestion to make the compiler complain about an uncovered case in case more enum items are added in the future, and this function is not updated.

events.message: Make IsSegWitOutput return true for taproot outputs

events.body: I took another approach, and made it us `IsWitnessProgram` instead of trying to match against all variations that now exist as output from `Solver`.

ACK 8465978f235e2e43feb5dabe2a4d61026343b6ab

Could this use test coverage?

comments.body: nit: Maybe turn this into a switch-case to get compiler output when v2 is added, but this isn't updated?
@sipa Are you still working on this? Happy to take over if not.
This would return true for Taproot scripts that are in the P2SH even though such scripts cannot be spent. Do we want to do that?
Yes, I noticed that, but I think my answer is yes. It also used to return true for unknown witness versions, so no reason to exclude v1 p2sh. It's still segwit; just not taproot.
